title: SB 1.17.42 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 22-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chaksharan Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
In this session we will be discussing from the 42nd verse of the 17th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Vrishasya Nashtam Streen Paadan Tapas Chowcham Dayamiti Pratisandhatha Ashwasya Mahimcha Samavardhayat
The meaning of this verse is
Vrishasya Nashtam Streen Paadan Tapas Chowcham Dayamiti Pratisandhatha Ashwasya Mahimcha Samavardhayat
Thereafter the king re-established the lost legs of the personality of religion, the bull, and by encouraging activities, he sufficiently improved the condition of the earth.
Vrishasya Nashtam Streen Paadan Tapas Chowcham Dayamiti Pratisandhatha Ashwasya Mahimcha Samavardhayat
So this is Suta Goswami describing the result of Parikshit Maharaj.

the punishment and reward of Kali
Vrishasya Nashtam Streen Paadan Tapas Chowcham Dayamiti Pratisandhatha Ashwasya Mahimcha Samavardhayat
punished and Kali was also rewarded because Kali surrendered when he saw that Kali Purusha saw that
his life is in danger he completely surrendered to Pariksit Maharaj and as is the
religious principle that a surrendered soul is never killed so Pariksit Maharaj did not kill
Kali Purusha instead he gave him suitable shelter because kali purusha surrendered and asked for
shelter so a surrendered soul seeking shelter whoever he
surrendered to asked for shelter and he was served to only surrender to Kali Purusha gesture
may be is always given proper shelter by a righteous king strictly following the principles
of dharma like Maharaj Pariksit. So Kali was given four places in the beginning and since
there were no such places where in Pariksit's kingdom where those four pillars of sinful life
Deutham Panam Sriyasuna none of those activities were going on against scriptural injunctions in
Pariksit's kingdom. So Kali Purusha asked for a fifth place and
Kali Purusha asked for a fifth place and
he was given that place where gold is accumulated and kept for sense gratification because wherever
there is gold there are these four kinds of activities gold kept for sense gratification
these four sinful activities and in addition there will be enmity also.
So Kali became gold standardized as Prabhupada says in one of the previous purports.
So then the damage done by Kali Purusha was set right was corrected and that is being
described here in this particular verse that the lost legs of the personality of religion
were re-established.
That is described here as the four pillars as they of dharma dharma stands on austerity cleanliness
mercy and truthfulness.
So in Satya Yuga all the four pillars of dharma were intact and as wise was the wise was the wise.
So in Satya Yuga all the four pillars of dharma were intact and as wise was the wise.
So in Satya Yuga all the four pillars of dharma were intact and as wise was the wise.
So in Satya Yuga all the four pillars of dharma were intact and as wise was the wise.
In Treta Yuga one of the pillars of dharma gradually got lost and in Dwapar yuga two
pillars got lost that is Tapaha in Treta yuga got lost in Shaucham got lost in addition
in Dwapar Yuga and in the beginning Kali Yuga three are lost Tapaha, Shaucham and Daya and just
Kali Yuga is about to begin but Parikshit Maharaj by taking appropriate steps re-established those
three lost pillars of Dharma and he also sufficiently improved the condition of the earth
by encouraging activities. So Srila Prabhupada explains in the purport what does this mean
for present day people we who are living in this Kali Yuga after about five thousand years have
passed. What does it mean for us? So Prabhupada says in the purport by designating particular
places for the personality of Kali Maharaj Parikshit practically cheated Kali.
In the presence of Kali Dharma in the shape of the bull
and the earth in the shape of a cow he could actually estimate the general condition of his
kingdom and therefore he could take at once proper steps to re-establish the legs of the bull namely
austerity, cleanliness and mercy. And for the general benefit of the people of the world
he saw that the gold stock might be employed for stabilization.
This is a very very important point. He took the steps to re-establish the proper
steps to re-establish the legs of the Dharma namely austerity, cleanliness and mercy and
he also employed the gold stock that was kept, with all being used for Krishnan service for
devotional service he used it for would have been beautiful oro blessing . So this is a very important question.

Gold is certainly a
generator of falsity, intoxication, prostitution,
enmity and violence. But, under
the guidance of a proper king or public leader or a Brahmin or Sanyasi,
the same gold can be properly utilized to
reestablish the lost legs of the bull, the personality of
religion.
By itself, wealth or gold is not bad.
The improper or proper
utilization, that matters.
How you use that gold is
important. If you use it properly,
you can use it to
maintain or restore
the lost legs of Dharma. Or, people may
misuse it and further degradation
sets in and the Dharma
becomes lost.
So, Srila Prabhupada says, specifically what did he do?
Maharaj Parikshit, therefore, like his grandfather Arjuna,
collected all illicit gold kept for the propensities of
Kali and employed it for the purpose of
and employed it in the Sankirtan Yajna
as per the instruction of the Srimad Bhagavatam.
Bhagavatam says, in Kali Yuga,
other types of Yajna are not practical.
In the Bhagavad Gita and all the scriptures it is said,
work should be done as Yajna
so that people don't become entangled
in this material world.
So, there are varieties of Yajna that one may perform,
but in Kali Yuga, the most practical
and feasible type of Yajna is Sankirtan Yajna.
So therefore, Parikshit Maharaj,
like his grandfather,
Arjuna, he employed all the illicit gold
kept for propensities of Kali.
Illicit gold means gold that has been accumulated
for sense enjoyment that he utilized in Sankirtan Yajna.
And that is a recommendation of the Bhagavatam.
As we have suggested before,
Prabhupada gave instructions in a previous purport
that I read in detail, the 38th verse purport.
It is very big.
We covered it in three sessions, three parts.
And there, one of the recommendations Prabhupada had given
that once accumulated wealth may be divided
into three parts for distribution.
Namely, 50% for the service of the Lord.
Lord means the Supreme Lord Krishna.
25% for the family members.
And 25% for personal necessities.
So, dividing one's wealth.
This for whom?
Particularly for people who have lot of excess wealth
than what is bare minimum required
for keeping body and soul together.
There are those who live by the principle that,
I will only take as much wealth as is necessary
for the minimum, bare minimum necessities
for maintaining this body while in the material world
because my main business will be simply to engage
in Krishna consciousness.
For such people, there is no need of any such business.
division to be made because they don't have that for dividing like this but for those who are
having excess wealth than what is minimum necessary there is a a way of dividing the
wealth into three parts what is that 50% for service of Krishna 25% for the family members

why because people of the world meaning the human being population of human beings are generally in
darkness regarding spiritual knowledge especially in regard to the devotional service of the Lord
and therefore to propagate the systematic transcendental knowledge of devotional service
is the greatest mercy that one can show in this world
there's a need especially in Kali Yuga people are in ignorance darkness of ignorance so they
do not know when they do not know how to utilize their excess wealth then what is bare minimum
required then default will be use it for sense gratification people become sinful and dharma
is destroyed then everything is spoiled the human mission is completely lost
whereas if 50% of the excess wealth is spent for propagating Sankirtan Yajna
then it is the best use of the available excess wealth and also it is the maximum
display of mercy on the human society so nobody will go astray from the path of
Dharma everybody will utilize this human form of life for its real purpose and
everybody will be able to go back to Godhead get out of this material
existence so that no more there is any repetition of birth and death I'll stop
